documentType: incident report or correctional facility log
summary: This document appears to be a correctional facility incident report noting that the wrong log book (I/M companion log) was used instead of the proper Staff Suicide Watch log for monitoring an inmate. The error was discovered, and a second log was completed using the correct form, with entries matching between both logs. It is addressed to an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Logbook Error and Correction
events.description: A correctional officer was assigned to staff watch but used the wrong log book (I/M companion log) instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log. The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was completed with matching entries.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the logbook incident occurred; addressed to an Associate Warden there.

keyFacts: A correctional officer used an incorrect log (I/M companion log) for a staff watch assignment instead of the proper Staff Suicide Watch log.
The error was discovered, prompting the completion of a second, correct log with identical entries.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is addressed to an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The incident suggests a procedural failure in the logging protocol for monitoring an inmate, potentially under suicide watch conditions.
